body:
I build the compiler that I want to use and add it to `etc/spack/defaults/compilers.yaml`.

That file does not not exist in the repository.  Once I've made the change it shows up as an untracked file.  I'm worried that I'll commit it in a fit of sloppiness at some point.

Would it be an appropriate addition to the top level .gitignore?
title: Should etc/spack/defaults/compilers.yaml be in the .gitignore?
